biog.entry.name: KING, the Hon. Catherine Fiona
biog.entry.description: Biography for KING, the Hon. Catherine Fiona
biog.entry.electorate.name: Member for Ballarat (Vic)
biog.entry.title: Biography for KING, the Hon. Catherine Fiona
biog.entry.electorate.state.name: Member for Ballarat (Vic)
biog.entry.party.name: Australian Labor Party

parliamentary.service.title: Parliamentary Service
parliamentary.service.para: Elected to the House of Representatives for Ballarat, Victoria, 2001, 2004, 2007, 2010 and 2013.

ministerial.appointments.title: Ministerial Appointments
ministerial.appointments.para: Minister for Regional Services, Local Communities and Territories from 25.3.13 to 1.7.13.
Minister for Road Safety from 25.3.13 to 1.7.13.
Minister for Regional Australia, Local Government and Territories from 1.7.13 to 18.9.13.
Parliamentary Secretary for Health and Ageing from 14.9.10 to 25.3.13.
Parliamentary Secretary for Infrastructure and Transport from 14.9.10 to 25.3.13.

committee.service.title: Committee Service
committee.service.para: House of Representatives Standing: Health and Ageing from 2.12.04 to 19.7.10; Infrastructure, Transport, Regional Development and Local Government from 19.2.08 to 19.7.10.
Joint Statutory: Public Accounts and Audit from 20.3.02 to 19.7.10.

parliamentary.party.positions.title: Parliamentary Party Positions
parliamentary.party.positions.para: Shadow Parliamentary Secretary for Regional Development (House) from 26.10.04 to 24.6.05; Shadow Parliamentary Secretary for Treasury from 24.6.05 to 3.12.07.
Member, Opposition Shadow Ministry from 14.10.13. Shadow Minister for Health from 18.10.13.

party.positions.title: Party Positions
party.positions.para: Member, ALP Health and Community Services Policy Committee 1998-2000.
Member, ALP Ballarat East Branch from 2000.
Secretary, ALP Caucus Committee on Urban, Regional and Rural Development 2002-04.
Member, ALP Caucus Committee on Economics.
Member, ALP Caucus Committee on Status of Women.

quals.work.pre.parliament.title: Qualifications and Occupation before entering Federal Parliament
quals.work.pre.parliament.para: BA (Social Work) (Philip Institute of Technology), MA (Public Policy)(ANU).
Social worker, Ballarat Children's Homes and Family Services 1988-92.
Research officer to the Parliamentary Secretary to the Minister for Health 1993.
Industry policy officer, Australia New Zealand Food Authority 1993-94.
Assistant Director, Population Health Division, Commonwealth Dept of Health and Aged Care 1997-98; Assistant Director, National Public Health Partnership.
Director, Injury Prevention, Population Health Division, Commonwealth Dept of Health and Aged Care 1998-99.

honours.title: Honours
honours.para: Victorian Young Achiever of the Year (Community Service) 1991.

electorate.title: Electorate
electorate.para: Location: inner-west Victoria; it includes the city of Ballarat and the centres of Ballan, Blackwood, Buninyong, Clunes, Creswick, Daylesford, Myrniong and Trentham, and parts of Burrumbeet.
Industries: beef cattle, sheep, potatoes, apples, mineral water, market gardening and gold mining, tourism, clothing and fabrics, sawmilling, engineering and confectionery.
State electorates: Ballarat includes the Victorian Legislative Assembly electorate of Wendouree, and parts of Buninyong, Macedon, Melton and Ripon.
